name: Major Dimension III Matte Eyeshadow Palette
about: What it is:A velvety matte eyeshadow palette that blends warm and cool nudes for ultimate versatility...Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:The shades in this palette can be worn alone or layered, blended, and contoured to create the most multi-dimensional looks that go from day to night. The cream bases allow you to really sculpt and intensify your eye looks. The shadows can be worn alone or layered over the bases for maximum depth and richness..This Palette Contains:.Palette Size:Full size

how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Start with the cream base to create the perfect canvas for your shadows and to enhance the richness of the pigment..-Layer your favorite shadows as desired..-Top with Patrick Ta Beauty's Make It Major Multidimensional Eye Topper (sold separately).

reviews.review_title: A Luxurious but Pricey Everyday Essential
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Patrick Ta's Major Dimensions III eyeshadow palette is a stunning collection of highly pigmented and blendable shades. The creamy liners are a dream to apply, and the neutral tones are perfectly curated for creating effortlessly chic everyday looks that flatter a range of skin tones. The sleek and sophisticated packaging elevates the overall experience. However: The price point of this palette is undeniably steep. While the quality is undeniable, it's difficult to justify the cost for many. Overall: Despite the hefty price tag, Patrick Ta's Major Dimensions III is a beautiful palette that delivers exceptional performance. If you're seeking high-quality shadows and are willing to invest, this could be a worthwhile addition to your collection. Key takeaways:  * Pros: Highly pigmented, blendable, creamy liners, beautiful neutral shades, sleek packaging  * Cons: Expensive I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: These colors are pigmented and easily blendable. Truly one of the first eyeshadow pallets where I was in awe with the color pay off and how seamlessly my eye look came out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Received for Christmas and this is my favorite palette. Very easy to blend, creamy and bold. Very pigmented. Expensive but very much with it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I hate giving bad reviews but this palette its very expensive so I was expecting it to be worth the price. I could seriously care less about the packaging but The lack quality of the shadows bother me a lot, I will definitely return it powedered shadows are lowthepopoedw

reviews.review_title: Mold? SOURNESS SMELL!! RUN Get Anastasia Soft Glam
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Upon picking this up, I got home excited to use it. Once I got my brush on and putting it to my eye I can smell this sourness coming from my brush thought ok weird. I swap another color and put on my second layer on again same smell coming from my brush. I smell the palate nothing stunk but only the brush. So I grabbed a new brush swap another color and same thing so not sure if the palate is old or molding? Will be returning this as I have done some research come to find out this brand is known for mold!? I wonder how long this palate has been sitting on the shelf before picking it up. But am disappointed as I really wanted to like this product. As you can see on the picture there is dots looking like mold on the black creme. For the price and the hype sorry but I have sensitive skin and my eyes has been acting up since the swap. I rather go back to my Anastasia Soft Glam for the price her palate is more pigmented too compare to this. Too bad I wasted my 20 % on this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was curious if the price tag was worth the product after eyeing this for over a year, but once I got it, I couldnu2019t put it down! The creams are so easy to blend and the powders sit nice on top and also blend great.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I really love this pallet! Easy application, beautiful result every time. Wouldu2019ve been an easy 5 stars but the price is just a little too much. I believe in paying in quality, but come on. Overall, love it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve had this product for less than 6 months and 3 different shades have come clean off the pallet and broken. Super disappointing given the price

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm obsessed. The warm tones are perfect for elegant and versatile looks. The matte shadows are creamy and easy to blend, while the shimmers have incredible pigmentation. Plus, the cream shades are great for intensifying the look. I'll be wearing this for Christmas and New Year without a doubt!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I seen the reviews wanted to see for myself glad I did . my first thing is how are you storing your makeup because mine is in a dark cool drawer and it's golden had it for months no mold . second this is the most long lasting so blendable formula I've used next to pat mcgrath dare I say maybe even better for mattes . I couldn't believe how easily this was to work with and how beautiful I looked this would be the perfect matte wedding eyeshadow or even a everyday . I absolutely love this one.  sometimes you just need to experience things for yourself because had I listened to all the reviews I would have skipped this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I'm super disappointed in the quality of this product. I just received this palette from the Sephora sale and without touching the product I see mold in the cream product. At first I thought it was a glitter or dust but I haven't seen any reviews in the cream shadows having glitter or being textured and fearing for my eye safety I will be returning this product and no longer will be interested in another Patrick Ta eyeshadow palette. This is unacceptable for being $70 USD!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This was one of the worst eyeshadow palettes I have ever used!  I have light-medium skin tone and 5 of the shadows didnu2019t even show up on my skin.  Even the darker shades have to be built up.  It is suppose to be buildable color but there is so much fallout, I feel like I would hit the bottom of the pan after a few weeks.  For $70 I expected much better quality. I will be returning this one!

reviews.review_title: On paper this works, but it lacks longevity.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Iu2019ve used a lot of eyeshadows, but this is really the first one in a long time that I can say doesnu2019t stay on my eyelids all day. I use urban decay eyeshadow primer. Iu2019ve tried this with them without the cream base underneath. Thatu2019s in this pallet. They look really pretty on but then Several hours later I look in the mirror and I donu2019t see much eyeshadow. I donu2019t know if it just disappears or if the pigment fades or whatever. Iu2019ve also use this with a eyeshadow, brush, dam and with urban decay all nighter spray. I really want to like this a lot, but Iu2019m on the fence. I also wish this came with at least a couple of shimmers to make the colors pop.

reviews.review_title: This is the neutral palette I've been waiting for
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love a predominately neutral eye but was so on the fence about spending this much money on a palette as every other I've owned comes predominately with shades that pull too pink, muddy or warm for my skin or simply don't come with enough lighter shades for my skin tone. This is - to my absolute shock and delight - perfection! - with both warmer and cooler shades that all play well together, formulation that goes on like butter with no fall off and coverage that is just right to allow for lighter to more saturated application. One of the rare neutral palettes where I'll use almost all the shades included making it the very happy end of my hunt for one palette that does it all for the mattes and one I can see working with a variety of skin tones.

Je pense que c'est la plus belle palette que je possu00e8de. Les couleurs vont avec tout. C'est la palette parfaite pour un look neutre. Les fards sont doux. Les cru00e8mes sont bien aussi. Si j'avais une seule palette u00e0 choisir u00e7a serait celle-ci. Elle est universelle.

reviews.review_text: This is the ultimate neutral palette. So versatile: I can do a sultry smoked-out glam look or a soft no-makeup look with this palette. I also love that there are both cool & warm tones in this palette along with the creamy brown & black.I use this daily-definitely worth it.

I do wish the shadows held up better! I donu2019t feel as though the powder products really set the cream. After a few hours I always experience the shadow rubbing away. I do have really oily eyelids and donu2019t use an eye primer though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: After about 2 weeks of wearing shadows from this palette, I've come to a few conclusions. The  lightest 2 shadows look chalky on my brow bone and lots of fallout.  The warms are too orangey for me. I am fair with blue eyes, so usually coppery brown tones look good, but these are really orange, like disco trendy orange, not a good neutral. In general I'm finding the extreme matte of these hard to blend and work with. I don't usually struggle putting on shadow, but these are um, difficult to make look right? It's just never going to be a go-to palette for me, not worth the price. I love Tartes palette of similar colors but with a few mildly sparkly light shades for highlights. I've had that one a few years and love it.  Those last forever on and are easy to work with, not so with the PT palette.

reviews.review_text: When I first got this palette I was struggling with applying and blending. HOWEVER once I got an eyeshadow primer this went on like butter! An everyday palette that lets me go from simple work makeup to stunning nighttime looks. I have a separate set of shimmer shadows I add on top of the shadows from this palette. It is a learning curve, but the colors are stunning. I received it as a gift originally, and now Iu2019ll be rebuying in the future.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: After using this palette multiple times, these are my opinions. Out-of-this-world pigmentation. Definitely, creams must be setting with powder. They have fallout, but not severe. They are not dry formulas. It is very easy to blend. The cool brown next to the black is patchy. They are not suitable for use with a moisturizing primer. On the contrary, something drier is better. So, take it into account. If you have an oily eyelid, I can't recommend this palette. Successful selection of shades. I think it's a must-have. The packaging is luxurious and beautiful.The fingers are obviously marked in some areas.So, for those obsessed with everything looking perfectly clean it is chaos (I appreciate the detail that it is not completly metallic, unlike other Patrick Ta products). But it is what it is. Nobody talks about it, but the mirror is great.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I think this palette is incredibly overhyped. They're great eyeshadows as far as pigment and blendability goes, but I find the cooler tones to be almost grey-looking on when they look a bit more neutral in the pan. I wear neutral to neutral warm foundation, but the way the bottom row pulls on me is so grey and dead. If you're cooler toned, maybe the bottom row would look better on you.   I also just don't see a big benefit to the creams in the palette, they don't hold up well enough to use as a liner without smudging.   I thought this was going to be my ultimate palette as I typically am a matte nude type of girl on a daily basis, but there are a solid 5 pans in here I probably won't ever use so at $70, I'll be returning. I think there are other palettes that are available much cheaper that accomplish the same thing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am a East Asian woman who is a cool undertone. I usually stick to Korean brand eye palettes as they suit my complexion and Asian features better (color wise) but I heard so many great things about this palette, and especially since Patrick Ta himself is Asian. I love how creamy the eyeshadow formula is and how smooth it glides onto the eyes. I do also have the makeup by mario palette and that palette is very chalky in comparison to this, so if you are debating between the two get the Patrick Ta one! I love that there are cool AND warm tone shadows in this palette. I was very iffy about the gel eyeliner as I have monolid eyes, and if it's not waterproof I will not use it. However, this gel liner stays on all day and is SUPER pigmented!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: OMG!!! This is the only palette you will ever need. It has it all cool tone and warm tone colors. Blends out like butter and the pigments chefs kiss!!! Yes it is a bit on the pricey side but absolutely absolutely absolutely worth every single penny. One dab is all you need the pigments are absolutely fantastic. Because a little goes a very long way this one palette will last you forever. I am absolutely addicted and seriously one of the absolute best items I have ever bought. I don't know what kind of Genius Patrick Ta is but he is a magical wizard when it comes to makeup. I will absolutely keep repurchase this again and again. And recommend it to any and everyone I can.

reviews.review_title: Thicker creamy pigmented formula that creases.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was sent this palette by Sephora and Patrick Ta as a Sephora Beauty Insider Community Ambassador.  I prefer cooler tones so was excited to see a neutral palette that had both cool and warm tones and very much enjoy the layout of the shades.  I found the packaging to be weighted and the mirror worked great.  Pleased there was a shield over the cream shadows to prevent fallout from getting into the creams.  I first used this palette on a video call with Sephora make up artists giving direction and found that the look came out looking cakey.  The shadows themselves are VERY creamy.  It was far too easy to pick up way too much shadow.  I played around with it after that using a MUCH lighter hand being sure to pick up way less shadow and the looks weren't as intensely pigmented but looked much better in real life.  I chalk the first cakey look up to learning how to use the formula.  The cream shows were far too dark for me use as a base and when I did try, they would just lay on top of the skin, if I used less of the cream product it looked patchy on the lid.  Using the cream as a liner worked great and it was easy to line the eyes, however if I touched my eyes through the day, the liner moved, it never set, even with a powder over top.  Overall this palette has a beautiful colour story, but the cream shades aren't for me and no matter which primer I did use the mattes creased on me after only a few hours, no matter how light handed I was.  I do normally get creasing with most shadow formulas, however it usually takes longer than a few hours for this to happen.  I'm sure this could be an every day palette for some, however for me it wasn't a hit.

I like to focus more on how a shadow performs than the packaging, but I know a lot of people do carry about packaging. It really does feel like a high end palette. Itu2019s heavy and sleek and the large mirror is great for traveling.  I know this can be a high price, but out of all the palettes Iu2019ve tried I havenu2019t found one with such high quality. Patrick really perfected matte eyeshadows and I donu2019t know how anyone will top this palette! Considering I use this everyday, I would definitely spend the money to repurchase it.   I recieved this from Influenster and Patrick Ta in exchange for my honest review.
